topics.body:
"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c1e3916368727ab9d31600#post_54c1e3916368727ab9d31600
I would have to agree with this here that we couldn't comprehend what hypothetical supernatural entities look like.  Personally I think even if we did see them we would instantly forget what they look like or sound like because our brains wouldn't be able to register.

For all we know we could be walking down the street and constantly going "OH MY GOD! IT'S GOD!  QUICK TAKE A PICTURE AND SHOW EVERYONE!. . . Why do I have my cellphone out?  And why was I going to message all my friends a picture of a empty parking lot?"

topics.body: Well, GOOD NIGHT ALL!!!!1
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c1eac26368720d24cc2800#post_54c1eac26368720d24cc2800
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c1eb2463687278816b0200#post_54c1eb2463687278816b0200
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c1eb6b6368722790744100#post_54c1eb6b6368722790744100
Aww; thanks.

Sometimes I feel hard on myself cause I fully admit that I'm partially insane, but what sucks massive balls about having mental problems is that instantly everything you say gets written off 100% of the time.
[spoiler]
I've had three extreme cases of this where even though the other people saw it as well it got written off as "uc9's talking crazy talk again".  The first example of this was when I was little we were all playing Jenga; someone decided to be a jackass and knock over cause he knew he was going to lose; the crazy thing about that is that it didn't fall until the dude took a second swipe so that was a good five seconds of completely ignoring gravity and even though twenty people saw it I got written off.  "Did you guys see how that jenga tower didn't fall?"  "Yes; what about it?"  "Have you ever seen anything like that?" "No and that's important how?"  "We witnessed a violation of physics"  "You're crazy; we know you have mental problems so therefore you're crazy"  "You saw it too".  The second example of this was a couple years back we were painting the house and one second the line masking tape was there and then gone right in front of everyone; even though everyone saw it didn't click how weird it was for something to just pop gone.

It's legitimately aggrevating cause without fail everything I always say gets written off immediately.  It's one of the questions I ask myself on a regular basis; I know I have severe problems, but why the fuck did everyone else see those incidents too and why did they instantely write it off as "oh uc9's being crazy again" if they saw it as well?  Totally going into tinfoil hat mode, but it's almost as if people are programmed to ignore anything and everything weird even if large numbers of people all saw the same thing.  Hypothetically you could have the mythological lock ness monster having a tea party with mythological big foot and the second the person witnessing it looks away they would instantly forget it or ignore it pretending it didn't happen.  Am I crazy?  Am I not crazy?

You can see how aggrevating it must be.[/spoiler]
